title: Week in pictures: 26 September - 2 October 2020
description: A selection of remarkable images taken around the world this week.

title: The 1960s report that told the USA it was racist
description: How the Kerner Commission blamed white racism for the riots of 1967

title: Covid: UK live music scene on 'red alert' amid pandemic
description: Brit Awards winner KT Tunstall backs a campaign to save the grassroots music sector.

title: August Browne: The Nigeria-born man who joined the Polish resistance
description: August Agboola Browne is thought to have been the only black person in the Polish resistance.

title: Airbnb blocks US Halloween bookings over party fears
description: The company wants to crack down on house parties after concerns of a second Covid wave.

title: Children's fiction: Cardiff writer's debut book nets him six-figure deal
description: Film rights for The Beast and the Bethany are being sought by a Harry Potter film producer.

title: German reunification: Young Germans in search of their eastern roots
description: As Germany celebrates 30 years of reunification, many still identify with a state that has vanished.

title: 'Bittersweet' farewell for Scotland's oldest miniature railway
description: The 85-year-old attraction plans a "big send-off" after falling visitor numbers force its closure.

title: Maliwawa Figures: Ancient Aboriginal art 'unlike anything seen before'
description: The Maliwawa Figures offer a glimpse into life more than 6,000 years ago, scientists say.

title: Covid-19: Working from India's beaches and mountains during the pandemic
description: Many Indian professionals have been working from home, but some have taken the concept a step further.

title: What happens to old cruise ships?
description: The cruise industry was hit hard by the pandemic, and no-sail orders put in place by some countries.

title: Covid-19 left me jobless - but what happened next?
description: These people lost their jobs early in the coronavirus crisis. How have these past months been?

title: What older voters make of Trump Covid story
description: We asked some older US voters for their reactions to the president's Covid-19 diagnosis.

title: Tony Vargas in Nebraska: One man's Covid crusade in rural America
description: It was a battle against time for Tony Vargas, who put personal tragedy aside to do what he thought was right.

title: Trump Covid: The US president's seven days before his positive test result
description: The US president's positive test result came after a busy week of campaigning, debating and events.

title: Conservative conference: Worried party want to see the 'Old Boris'
description: Boris Johnson is being urged to set a clearer vision for the future at the virtual Tory conference, writes Iain Watson.

title: Trump on Covid-19 in his own words
description: A look back at what US President Donald Trump has said about Covid-19 since February.

title: Russian editor dies after setting herself on fire
description: Irina Slavina earlier left a message blaming "the Russian Federation for my death".

title: Trump did not call Covid-19 a 'hoax' - and other false claims
description: The president's diagnosis caused a wave of rumour, speculation and misinformation online.

title: US election 2020: Fact-checking Trump on coronavirus
description: The president has tested positive for Covid - we've looked at what he's said about the virus.

title: Nasa Wallops launch: Astronauts to test new $23m toilet at space station
description: Astronauts will test the female-friendly toilet before its probable use in a future lunar mission.

title: What's the story with the gone-in-a-flash Covid app alerts?
description: Users of the England and Wales contact-tracing apps are reporting getting alerts which then vanish.

title: Storm Alex brings heavy rain and high winds to parts of UK
description: Gale-force winds reached 61mph in southern England on Friday, as drivers were urged to be "cautious".

title: Asda bought by billionaire Issa brothers in £6.8bn deal
description: Zuber and Mohsin Issa and TDR Capital are buying a majority stake in the UK supermarket from Walmart.

title: Brexit: EU calls for trade talks to 'intensify' ahead of call with UK
description: Ursula von der Leyen made the call ahead of virtual meeting with Boris Johnson on Saturday.

title: Jon Bon Jovi: 'My hair is turning grey. I'm cool with that'
description: Aged 58, Bon Jovi has written his most political album yet. "I had to bear witness," he tells the BBC.

title: Margaret Ferrier: Nicola Sturgeon urges Covid trip MP to 'do the right thing'
description: Margaret Ferrier is being urged to resign after she travelled from London to Scotland after a positive test.

title: Covid: Donald Trump and Melania test positive
description: The US president and Melania Trump were tested after his close aide was confirmed to have Covid-19.

title: Covid: Growth in Covid cases 'may be levelling off'
description: More evidence suggest new coronavirus infections may be rising more slowly than in previous weeks.

title: Archie Lyndhurst's mum remembers 'most wonderful unique' son
description: Lucy Smith says the actor, who has died aged 19, brought "us nothing but joy in our lives".

title: What is the risk to Donald Trump's health?
description: The US president has multiple risk factors for developing a severe form of Covid-19, so what does it mean?

title: Post Office scandal: Postmasters celebrate huge victory against convictions
description: Dozens of postmasters should get a clear path in quashing convictions following years of campaigning.

title: Land speed record bid: Maximuscle founder Zef Eisenberg killed
description: Zef Eisenberg is killed at the same airfield where he had a "near-death" 230mph crash in 2016.

title: Honda: Red Bull engine partner to leave F1 at end of 2021
description: Red Bull's engine partner Honda is to leave Formula 1 at the end of 2021.

title: Asylum seekers: UK considered floating barriers in Channel
description: The Home Office looked at the idea to deter asylum seekers crossing, according to latest leaks.

title: Strictly Come Dancing's HRVY tests positive for coronavirus
description: The pop singer and YouTube star is self-isolating but is still expected to take part in the series.

title: Ms Marvel on TV: A 'bold move for Marvel to diversify their characters'
description: An 18-year-old Canadian newcomer is reportedly cast for the Disney+ series and future MCU films.

title: Should you be buying a second-hand smartphone?
description: Selling refurbished electronics is a fast-growing business where customers can make big savings.

title: Oasis: 'I thought I split the band in Morning Glory recording sessions'
description: How Oasis' seminal masterpiece (What's The Story) Morning Glory? almost didn't happen.

title: Coronavirus: 'Eighteen years of my life has just gone'
description: UK firms are struggling or going under as new Covid restrictions bite, industry groups warn.

title: Your pictures on the theme of 'open road'
description: A selection of pictures from our readers on the theme of "open road".

title: Burgess stands down amid police investigation into alleged drug use and domestic violence
description: Former England captain Sam Burgess steps down as South Sydney Rabbitohs assistant coach while police investigate allegations against him.

title: Meet the teens who developed a dementia app which uses music
description: A group of Nigerian-Irish teens have developed the Memory Haven app to help people with dementia.

title: Coronavirus: Australia opens 'travel zone' to New Zealanders
description: It is the first opening of borders by either nation since Covid restrictions were imposed.

title: China National Day: Hong Kong peace 'is an illusion'
description: Last year, China's National Day saw violent clashes between police and protesters in Hong Kong.

title: Ashnikko: 'I don't take no for an answer'
description: The US singer and rapper talks mental health, female powerhouses and fangirling Avril Lavigne.

title: Our complicated relationship with body hair removal and grooming
description: BBC reporter Niamh Hughes takes a look at different approaches to body hair whilst examining her relationship with her own.

title: Coronavirus: How pandemic sparked European cycling revolution
description: Governments have invested millions on cycling during the pandemic. Here's what's changed.

title: He's stuck in a room with Covid miles from home, says student's dad
description: Students and parents tell of university isolation woes as cases hit nearly half of UK universities.

title: Quiz of the week: Whose Instagram record did Attenborough beat?
description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

title: Will next summer's exams be cancelled?
description: How will A-levels and GCSEs be run next year when so much teaching time has been lost?
